info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 06 at 3:02AM EST until March 06 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM EST FOR SOUTHWESTERN MADISON AND EASTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES... At 302 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Noblesville, or 17 miles west of Anderson, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Lapel around 310 AM EST. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Pendleton, Edgewood and Anderson. This includes Interstate 69 near mile marker 210, and between mile markers 219 and 220. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
